page.title: 04Scroggs Pond in Wharton Wood
page.content: This pond which is really a small lake was formed around 1912, it is about 1.5 metres in depth The largest fish ever caught was a 10 pounds (4.5 kilograms). Other fish in the lake include: tench, perch, roach and eels. To be able to fish the lake you must be a member of the Gainsborough Angling Club, only 50 people can fish the lake with a special permit. Other people who wish to fish the lake have to put their names on a waiting list. There are 7 types of bird who live on and visit the lake: mallard, canadian goose, tufted duck, teal, water hen, heron, and willow wabler. The pond is polluted by nitrogen,this chemical is used on the land as a fertilizer, and is leeched out of the soil by rain which then drains into the pond.
